scripts._build:dev: npm run -s _touchDevLocalEnv && make refresh-build && docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml run --rm build
scripts.preinstall:
(echo "${npm_config_omit}" | grep -q peer) || ( echo >&2 "***	Please install with '--omit=peer'. We want to avoid local copies of 'vite', 'esbuild*' and 'rollup').
	This has to do with use of Docker Compose to run Vite.
"; false )
scripts.postinstall: if [ -z $BUILDER_OUTPUT ]; then npm run -s _postinstall_dev ; else npm run -s _postinstall_ci ; fi
scripts._postinstall_ci: make tmp/.env.ci_test tmp/firebase.app.ci.json tmp/local.config.ci.json fake.config.json firebase.json

[ x = y ]: Use only one '=', for pleasing WSL2. Otherwise it gives 'undefined operator'.
preinstall: In a normal install, the '@vitejs/plugin-vue' dependency would bring in vite (and esbuild, rollup) as peer dependencies.
We don't want that, since Vite already comes via a Docker image. On the other hand, '@vitejs/plugin-vue' deserves
to be right here, since it is specific to the front-end framework used (Vue 3).
postinstall: CI: Prepares files for both the testing and the deployment runs, each time.
